dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 3548 IH: Transparency Requirements for Agency Conferences and Events Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Kind (for himself and Mr. Paulsen) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform

form.official-title: To increase transparency of agencies by requiring a report describing any proposed conference.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Transparency Requirements for Agency Conferences and Events Act or the TRACE Act.

section.header: Reports on conference attendance by Federal agencies

subsection.text: Not later than 30 days before any conference, the head of the agency hosting the conference and the head of any agency that is sending an employee of such agency to the conference shall submit to the relevant congressional committee of jurisdiction a report on the following:

paragraph.text: An itemized statement of the cost of attending the conference, including the total cost.
In the case of the agency hosting the conference, the total cost of the conference.
A list of conference attendees from such agency and the titles of such attendees.
A summary of the purposes and goals of the conference.
The term agency has the meaning given that term in section 551 of title 5, United States Code.
The term conference means a meeting, retreat, seminar, symposium, training, or other event that involves travel for 50 or more attendees.
The term employee has the meaning given that term in section 2105 of title 5, United States Code.
